page.title: 05SOCIAL TRENDS IN TADLEY
page.content: Our survey area is typical of wealthy Conservative-voting South East England. It is part of "Silicon Valley" and is surrounded by growing numbers of computer and peripheral industries, and increasingly by the headquarters of multi-national companies. Despite this, unemployment (at September 1985) stands at 7.9%. Many of the unemployed are young male school leavers for there is little manual work and few apprenticeships. But the majority of the people are comfortably off; owner occupiers; professional people. The only members of the ethnic minority communities we have been able to find are the proprietors of a Chinese Takeaway and an Indian Restaurant. A few Liberal candidates have been elected to local District Councils but in General Elections this is safe Tory ground.
